snippet: An American legal team concluded that while Yulia V. Tymoshenko’s rights were violated during her trial last year, her conviction was supported by the evidence.
abstract: American legal team commissioned by Ukrainian government concludes that rights of jailed former Ukrainian Prime Min Yulia V Tymoshenko were violated during her trial on abuse of power charges, and that she was wrongly imprisoned even before her conviction, but that her conviction was supported by evidence presented at trial.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and DAVID E. SANGER
byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn reported from Moscow, and David E. Sanger from Washington.

lead_paragraph: An American legal team concluded that while Yulia V. Tymoshenko’s rights were violated during her trial last year, her conviction was supported by the evidence.

headline.main: Failings Found in Trial of Ukrainian Ex-Premier
headline.print_headline: Failings Found in Trial Of Ukrainian Ex-Premier
